ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: COVID-19, commonly referred to as coronavirus, is no more severe than the flu.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am afraid of dying from or contracting coronavirus.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Diseases that primarily affect the elderly are not that big of a deal.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: COVID-19 is so rare there is no need for me to worry about it.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: COVID-19 is the biggest threat to public health in recent years.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am extra cautious around Asian people in order to protect against COVID-19.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: One of the best ways to reduce the spread of COVID-19 is to stop immigration into the United States.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Because of COVID-19, America should reduce its interactions with China.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I find it racist when people refer to coronavirus as "Chinese coronavirus" or "Wuhan disease".
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The global spread of COVID-19 was planned and orchestrated.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: COVID-19 emerged from natural conditions.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: COVID-19 was engineered in a laboratory.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The scientific community is spreading fake news about COVID-19.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Some politicians are making a big deal out of COVID-19 for political gain.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: COVID-19 is not as serious as some politicians say it is.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Politicians who downplay COVID-19's health risks are putting people's lives in danger.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Some reporters and members of the media are making COVID-19 seem like a bigger deal than it really is.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: News outlets are doing a good job communicating information relevant to COVID-19.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The media is politically motivated to play-up coronavirus to make Donald Trump and other Republicans look bad.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I fear the government will use COVID-19 as an excuse to mandate vaccinations.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am thankful that a COVID-19 vaccine does not exist.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: A COVID-19 vaccine will be one of the most effective measures in reducing the spread of the virus.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Medical organizations (e.g., CDC and WHO) are untrustworthy.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am skeptical of information provided by doctors and scientists.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Medical organizations (e.g., CDC and WHO) strive to make recommendations in the public's best interest.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: It is important to follow medical recommendations provided by medical organizations (e.g., the CDC and WHO).
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Your chances of getting a disease after being vaccinated against it are incredibly low.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Improved nutrition and sanitation played a larger role than vaccines in the decline of diseases like measles.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Recent outbreaks of diseases like measles and whooping cough show that vaccines don't work very well.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Vaccines are one of the most effective medical treatments.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The response to stop the spread of COVID-19 has caused more harm than the virus itself.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: We should stop social distancing as soon as possible to kickstart the economy.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: We should reopen the economy once we are confident there will be no more serious coronavirus outbreaks.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 7=Strongly agree
